org.jerkar.api.system

Class JkLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.system.JkLog

  • public final class JkLog
extends java.lang.Object
    Logger shared globally on the classloader. It provides time tracking method and indentation feature accounting for task/subtask execution.

    • Method Detail

      • silent

        public static void silent(boolean mode)
        Set the silent mode to the specified mode.
        See Also:
        silent()

      • silent

        public static boolean silent()
        Returns true if the logger is in silent mode. In silent mode, nothing is mogged.

      • verbose

        public static void verbose(boolean flag)
        Specifies the verbose mode #see verbose()

      • verbose

        public static boolean verbose()
        Returns true if the log is in verbose mode. In verbose mode the message logged with trace(String) are actually logged. They are not logged in non-verbose mode.

      • start

        public static void start(java.lang.String message)
        Logs a message indicating that a processing has been started. Elipsis are added at the end of the message and all subsequent logs will be shift right until done() is invoked.

      • infoStreamIfVerbose

        public static java.io.PrintStream infoStreamIfVerbose()
        Returns the the info strem if the log is currently in verbose mode. It returns null otherwise.
        Returns:

      • startln

        public static void startln(java.lang.String message)
        As start(String) but do a carriage return after the start message.

      • startUnderlined

        public static void startUnderlined(java.lang.String message)
        As startln(String) but underline the message.

      • startHeaded

        public static void startHeaded(java.lang.String message)
        As startln(String) but whith header message.

      • trace

        public static void trace(java.lang.String message)
        Logs the specified message if the logger is currently in verbose mode. Do nothing otherwise.

      • done

        public static void done()
        Notify that the processing notified with 'start' has terminated. The elapsed time between last start(String) invoke and this method invoke is notified. Also the the shifting due to last 'start' invoke is annihilated.

      • done

        public static void done(java.lang.String message)
        As done() but adding a tailored message.

      • info

        public static void info(java.lang.String message)
        Displays a message at info level.

      • info

        public static void info(java.lang.String message,
                        java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> lines)
        Displays a multi-line message of the specified message followed by specified lines.

        public static void info(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> lines)
        Displays multi-line message.

      • info

        public static void info(java.lang.String... lines)
        Displays multi-line message.

      • warn

        public static void warn(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> lines)
        Displays a multi-line message at warn level.

        public static void warn(java.lang.String message)
        Displays a message at warn level.

                          java.lang.String message)

      • delta

        public static void delta(int delta)
        Shifts the left margin. All subsequent log will be shifted delta characters to right.

      • offset

        public static int offset()
        Returns the current left margin size in character.
